overview.title: Welcome to SOIL: The Sustainable Farming Simulator
overview.description: Navigate the challenges and rewards of modern agriculture in this interactive simulation game.
overview.paragraph1: SOIL is an immersive simulation game where you step into the shoes of a farmer making crucial ecological and economic decisions. Experience the direct consequences of your choices on your virtual farm's health and productivity.
overview.paragraph2: Discover the principles of sustainable farming, master resource management, and understand the delicate balance between agricultural practices and environmental well-being. SOIL is designed to educate and engage players on the complexities of food production and its impact on our planet.

background.title: Background Information
background.paragraph1: The United Nations Conference on Environment and Development in 1992 declared "sustainability" a global development goal. This is to be achieved through an integrative view of economic, ecological, and social issues, enabling a fair distribution of life chances between current and future generations.
background.paragraph2: The German Conference of Ministers of Education and Cultural Affairs (KMK) therefore considers it a central task of schools to "enable students to actively shape an ecologically compatible, economically efficient, and socially just environment" (KMK, 2007, p. 1).
background.paragraph3: To convey the idea of sustainability based on a cohesive view of economy and ecology, the simulation game "Soil" was developed. In this game, students engage with the topic of agriculture. They are tasked with establishing a permanently productive agricultural operation in groups over ten (now configurable, e.g., 15) game rounds.
background.paragraph4: To achieve this goal, groups can steer the development of their farm by planting crops and choosing different cultivation methods. Feedback on the ecological and economic impacts of their decisions is provided after each game round. Based on this feedback, they can assess the success of their strategy and modify it if necessary.
background.paragraph5: This way, learners can discover the centrality of ecological variables as natural limits to their economic activities in a hands-on manner and thus learn to understand and manage sustainable development processes.
background.paragraph6: Further background information and complete game materials are available for download in the internal area of the homepage (for registered administrators). New games can also be created and managed there. Access to the internal area requires registration as a game administrator.
background.literatureParagraph: Recommendation of the Standing Conference of the Ministers of Education and Cultural Affairs of the Länder in the Federal Republic of Germany (KMK) and the German Commission for UNESCO (DUK) of June 15, 2007, on "Education for Sustainable Development in Schools".

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.introductionText: Welcome to the Soil Game. We are committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you use our application.
privacy.informationWeCollectText: We may collect information about you in a variety of ways. The information we may collect includes:
privacy.personalDataText: Personally identifiable information, such as your name (for administrators), email address, and institution (for administrators), that you voluntarily give to us when you register with the application. Player accounts may use system-generated or admin-provided email addresses.
privacy.derivativeDataText: Information our servers automatically collect when you access the application, such as your IP address, browser type, operating system, access times, and the pages you have viewed directly before and after accessing the application. This is standard server logging.
privacy.firebaseAuthDataText: When you register or log in using Firebase Authentication, Firebase collects certain data as described in their privacy policy. We receive your UID, email, and any custom claims we set (like role or game ID).
privacy.gameDataText: Information related to your gameplay, such as game session IDs, player decisions, parcel states, round results, and financial data within the game.
privacy.useOfInformationText: Having accurate information about you permits us to provide you with a smooth, efficient, and customized experience. Specifically, we may use information collected about you to:
useOfInformationList: Administer game sessions and facilitate gameplay.
Email you regarding your account or game notifications (e.g., new game credentials for admins, password resets).
Monitor and analyze usage and trends to improve your experience with the application.
Prevent fraudulent transactions, monitor against theft, and protect against criminal activity.
Respond to product and customer service requests.
privacy.disclosureOfInformationText: We do not share your personal information with third parties except as described in this Privacy Policy or with your consent.
privacy.disclosureByLawTitle: By Law or to Protect Rights:
privacy.disclosureByLawText: If we believe the release of information about you is necessary to respond to legal process, to investigate or remedy potential violations of our policies, or to protect the rights, property, and safety of others, we may share your information as permitted or required by any applicable law, rule, or regulation.
privacy.disclosureServiceProvidersText: We may share your information with third-party vendors, service providers, contractors, or agents who perform services for us or on our behalf and require access to such information to do that work (e.g., email delivery services, hosting services like Google Cloud Platform / Firebase).
privacy.securityOfInformationText: We use administrative, technical, and physical security measures to help protect your personal information. While we have taken reasonable steps to secure the personal information you provide to us, please be aware that despite our efforts, no security measures are perfect or impenetrable, and no method of data transmission can be guaranteed against any interception or other type of misuse.
privacy.yourDataRightsText: If you are a resident of the European Economic Area (EEA), you have certain data protection rights. We aim to take reasonable steps to allow you to correct, amend, delete, or limit the use of your Personal Data. These rights include:
yourDataRightsList: The right to access, update or delete the information we have on you.
